PATIENT_ID: TEST_HANG_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-01-22 02:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-01-22 02:10:00
Category I activation for 24-year-old male found by family.
History consistent with hanging. Ligature mark visible on neck.
Near-hanging with strangulation mechanism confirmed.
Airway assessment: patent, no stridor. Cervical spine immobilized.
BP 100/60, HR 110, RR 20, SpO2 94% on room air, GCS 10.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-01-22 02:15:00
Neck exam: circumferential ligature mark present at mid-cervical level.
Petechiae noted above the ligature line. No subcutaneous emphysema.
Neurologic status: patient responsive but confused.

[IMAGING] 2026-01-22 02:45:00
CT head: No acute intracranial hemorrhage. No signs of anoxic brain injury.
CT cervical spine: No fracture or subluxation.
CTA neck: No vascular injury identified.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-01-22 03:00:00
Anoxic brain injury not identified on initial imaging.
Airway secure and patent. Early neurologic evaluation completed.
Admit to ICU for monitoring and serial neurologic assessments.
